title: Quiz Master
name: quiz_master
description: You are going to be the quizmaster in a quiz game!

steps.title: Choose a Quiz Master
steps.description: Select from the Scratch library of characters and backdrops

components.text: Choose your quiz master from the Scratch Sprite Library
Go to the **Stage** and select a backdrop for the quiz

steps.title: Introduce the contestant
steps.description: Now that you have a quiz master, let's find out who the contestant is

components.text: Click on your quiz master character, and ask for the contestants name

components.blocks:
when FLAG clicked 
		ask [So contestant! What's your name?] and wait

components.text: Now introduce the contestant to the crowd, try these code blocks:

components.blocks:
say [...use your join code here...] for (2) secs 

 join [Great! We have a new contestant called ] (answer)

components.text: Click your quiz master to test it out. Type your name into the box. Do you need to add a space somewhere?
We want to remember your name, so need to create a **variable** called 'name'.
Make name be the answer to your question

steps.title: Time for the first question
steps.description: Now that you have a quiz master and contestant, let's program them ask questions.

components.text: Ask the first question
components.blocks: ask [So, Question 1: Which is the odd one out: Car, Plane or Bus?] and wait

components.text: This time we need to check if the answer is right, or wrong. Try:

components.blocks:
if ( (answer) = [Plane]) then 
	 say [well done! Plane is correct!] for (2) secs 
	 else 
	 say [unlucky, that's incorrect] for (2) secs

components.text: If you get it right
if you get it wrong
Now get the quiz master to use your name when replying. You might need the following:

steps.title: Add a score
steps.description: There's no fun getting it right if you don't get a score!

components.text: first create a variable called **score**
now we have to use the score. Add the following to your code, so **if** you get it right, you also get a point!
You need to make sure the score always starts from zero!
double click on the score display to make it look more like a score
You should have something that looks like this:

components.blocks:
if ( (answer) = [Plane]) then 
	 say [well done! Plane is correct!] for (2) secs 
	 change [score v] by (1) 
	  else 
	 say [unlucky, that's incorrect] for (2) secs

steps.title: More questions
steps.description: There's no fun getting it right if you don't get a score!

components.text: Can you think of other questions to ask your contestant? For example:

components.blocks: ask [Question 2: which of the following is not a plant? Saturn, Mars, Milky Way] and wait

steps.title: Prize giving
steps.description: Now that we have points, you can actually get a prize!

components.text: Can you use an _if_ block to check if the contestant get's a prize?
Perhaps if you get at least one point you get a prize
When you win, you want to go to the prize giving background
Say congratulations. Use Joins to make a clever sentence

steps.title: More contestants
steps.description: Now that you have it working with one contestant, can you add more?

components.text: You might want to consider adding other sprites
You might need to have a _score_ for each sprite. Using _just for this sprite_
